name: places/ChIJRyrk3aRYwokRinnotJFIXtU
formattedAddress: 1751 2nd Ave Suite AZ-5, New York, NY 10128, USA
adrFormatAddress: 1751 2nd Ave Suite AZ-5, New York, NY 10128-3459, USA

originalText.text:
Horrible experience with Pio. I started a new job and am new to my insurance. I looked for a therapist, found Pio and reached out. Initially we spoke for a quick consultation. I told him I can't do video because I am on a spiritual journey I hope that's okay. He said no problem. Perfect right? No lol things took a turn. He sent me some paperwork to fill out so I called my insurance to ask about the Claim ID, they helped and mentioned I have three EAP visits that my company covers that I can also add in the section. Pio accepts EAP so I thought nothing of it and put both numbers in the paperwork and sent them along. I sent the form a week ago. Last night he emails me complaining about the EAP. I replied I wasn't aware and if possible he can charge my regular ID number instead. When we join our Zoom call I remind him about the "no video" that we discussed during consultation and he responds he won't be able to move forward because he thought that was just for the initial call which he also thought I was taking during working hours. Which was very odd being that it was Saturday and I don't work on the weekends. I followed up on the email with his refusal to work with me because I could not be on video do to my religious beliefs and he replied calling stating I withheld information. The EAP? In the end Im grateful it happened because I do not want that type of person as my therapist.
Update: he‚Äôs even sent me two follow up emails about my review stating I‚Äôm spreading ‚Äúpoisonous venom‚Äù and seeking therapy isn‚Äôt something I would want my employers to know. Such an odd thing for a therapist to say.
Luckily I‚Äôm not embarrassed because it should be normalized.

(Update: thanks for reply üòå but I‚Äôm not a ‚Äúvictim‚Äù. Sharing the experience and your reply speaks for itself. Stay blessed.)

originalText.text: A truly compassionate therapist with a very calming demeanor and a pleasant office environment.
